sub_topic: Finding the chromatic polynomial of a graph.
message_1: Consider a graph with 7 vertices, where each vertex is connected to every other vertex. Find the chromatic polynomial of the graph.
message_2:
A graph with 7 vertices, where each vertex is connected to every other vertex, is called a complete graph and is denoted by K_7. The chromatic polynomial of a graph counts the number of proper colorings of the graph using k colors.

The chromatic polynomial P(G, k) of a complete graph K_n can be computed using the formula:

P(K_n, k) = k(k-1)(k-2)...(k-n+1)

In our case, n = 7, so the chromatic polynomial of K_7 is:

P(K_7, k) = k(k-1)(k-2)(k-3)(k-4)(k-5)(k-6)

This is the chromatic polynomial of the complete graph with 7 vertices.
